answers.answer: First off welcome to the forum.  I am sorry I do not have any experience with this but someone else may have.  I just wanted to comment (and PLEASE do not think I am being rude) about your post below.  I have seen it and I am sure others have as well.  We are not doctors on this forum (some are nurses though) and sometimes a post goes unanswered because we do not know.  This forum only allows so many ???? at a time before you can no longer open another.  My suggestion to you if you get no other help is to go to Google.com and type in HELLP or Pre-eclampsia and see all it brings up.  You may be surprised at the info you can get.  I do wish you luck and like I said I was NOT trying to be rude.  I do want to welcome you and let you know we really are very supportive here.   I am sorry I could not help you with this.

Pre-eclampsia is more common in first pregnancies, however, you should talk to your doc about the chances of in recurring in your second.  My girlfriend had it in her first, and they said she had a 70% chance of it recurring.

Pre-eclampsia IS more common in a first pregnancy, but you are at higher risk for it with any pregnancy, since you have had it before.  See your doctor prior to TTC, to get the best and most accurate advice for YOUR situation.

I had Preeclampsia with my first one. Because of this my doctor was monitoring me more closely with my 2nd and put me on blood pressure medication as soon as my blood pressure spiked. I didn't get it with my 2nd one.I've heard that low progesterone can cause early miscarriage. Progesterone is the hormone that (among other things) tells your uterus not to expell anything in it. When your progesterone gets low your period starts... so if your progesterone is too low while you are pregnant and causes a "miscommunication" with your uterus you'll miscarry. There are supplements your doctor can prescribe. I believe they work. Others don't believe they do. It's pretty controversial...Sorry- I don't know anything about HELLP syndrome...Hope I helped.

question: I am new to forums but I was just wondering if anyone here has ever had an experience with pre-eclampsia and HELLP Syndrome.  Or just low platelet counts in late pregnancy.  I had all of these problems with my first baby and am ready to try again and just wanted some advise on what chances may be of having the same problems second time around.  Also, ever heard of low progesterone causing early miscarriages?
title: Pre-eclampsia
